prompt: The SHACL shape :OrderCancellationShape targets all instances of the class food:OrderCancellation, requiring them to have at least two unspecified properties with a minimum cardinality of one each, and will fail validation with the message "Order cancellation must include a reason and refund status" if these properties are missing or invalid.

The SHACL shape :RestaurantContactShape applies to all instances of the class food:RestaurantContact, enforcing a single constraint on the mandatory property food:phoneNumber, which must have a value that is a string (xsd:string) matching the pattern "^\\+\\d{10,15}$", i.e., a valid international phone number starting with a "+" followed by 10 to 15 digits; if this property is missing or its value does not conform to this pattern, validation will fail with the message: "Restaurant contact must include a valid international phone number."

The SHACL shape :DishCategoryShape applies to all instances of the class food:DishCategory, mandating a single occurrence of the property food:categoryName with a string value (xsd:string) of at least 3 characters in length; validation will fail with the message "Dish category must have a name of at least 3 characters" if this constraint is not met.

Here is the improved translation:

The SHACL shape :OrderPaymentShape targets all instances of the class food:OrderPayment, requiring them to have exactly one value for the property food:paymentMethod, which must be the string "Card"; otherwise, validation will fail with the message "Order payment must specify the method used."

The SHACL shape :PackagingTypeShape targets all instances of the class food:PackagingType, mandating that each instance must have exactly one value for the food:materialType property, which must be a string (xsd:string), otherwise validation will fail with the message "Packaging type must include a material type."

The SHACL shape :CustomerFeedbackShape applies to all instances of the class food:CustomerFeedback, requiring them to have exactly one property food:feedbackText with a value that is a string (xsd:string) of at least 10 characters in length; if this constraint is not met, validation will fail with the message "Customer feedback must be at least 10 characters long."

The SHACL shape :DeliveryZoneShape targets all instances of the class food:DeliveryZone and specifies that each instance must have exactly one food:zoneName property with a string value (xsd:string) of at least 3 characters in length; if this property is missing or its value does not meet the minimum length requirement, validation will fail with the message: "Delivery zone must have a valid name."

Here is the rewritten translation:

The SHACL shape :OrderTimeWindowShape targets all instances of the class food:OrderTimeWindow, requiring exactly one string-valued property food:deliveryWindow, and will fail validation with the message "Order must include a delivery time window." if this property is missing or has an invalid value.

The SHACL shape :MenuAvailabilityShape targets all instances of the class food:MenuAvailability, requiring exactly one boolean value (xsd:boolean) for the property food:isAvailable to indicate availability, with a validation error message "Menu item must indicate availability." if this constraint is not met.

The SHACL shape :CustomerAccountShape targets all instances of the class food:CustomerAccount, requiring exactly one food:email property with a string value that matches the pattern "^.+@.+\\..+$", i.e., a valid email address, and specifies a validation failure message "Customer account must include a valid email address" if this constraint is not met.

The SHACL shape :DeliveryTipShape targets all instances of the class food:DeliveryTip, specifying that each must have exactly one property food:tipAmount with a value that is a non-negative floating-point number (xsd:float) with a minimum inclusive value of 0.0, and will produce the validation message "Delivery tip must be a non-negative amount." if this constraint is violated.

Here is the rewritten translation:

The SHACL shape :OrderTrackingShape targets all instances of the class food:OrderTracking and specifies a composite validation rule with two unnamed constraints that must both be satisfied, requiring a valid number and one of the allowed statuses to be present, with a corresponding error message if these conditions are not met.
